title: Print, "The Fire of Joy", ca. 1740
medium: Hand-colored etching with watercolor and gold on paper
inscribed: At bottom margin, left: "LE FEU DE JOYE"; on either side of the last are parts of a poem: "Tandis que d'un cote ce feu brille dans l'air/d'un tendre Jouvenceau fait eclatter la flamme," and "fris par ses attraits son mantien et son air/Devient pour tous les coeurs un feu qui les enflamme."
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Young men and women in varied costume hold hands and dance with their backs to a fire which is tended by others at right. In landscape with tree and houses.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "The Fire of Joy", ca. 1740.
ca. 1740. Hand-colored etching with watercolor and gold on paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1921-22-289.
